title: Greensville County Public Schools
text:
Greensville County Public Schools is a <a href="school%20division">school division</a> headquartered in <a href="Emporia%2C%20Virginia">Emporia, Virginia</a>, serving that city and <a href="Greensville%20County%2C%20Virginia">Greensville County</a>.
Circa 1972 there was an effort by Emporia residents to create a separate school division. On June 22, 1972, the <a href="United%20States%20Supreme%20Court">United States Supreme Court</a> denied the creation of the district on a 5–4 basis, with the four dissenters having been appointed by U.S. president <a href="Richard%20Nixon">Richard Nixon</a>.
Governance.
The district has four school board members from Greensville County and two from Emporia.
